transcript.text: Mobile phones and laptops are great for doing work on the go, but they can also make us vulnerable. Stay vigilant to protect yourself and everyone you work with.

contentText.text: When you use mobile phones, laptops or other portable devices, you’re carrying your workplace with you. Criminals look for opportunity wherever they can, so it’s important to stay vigilant and not expose ourselves to unnecessary risk.

revealCallOut.img: Two employees having a private conversation

popText.text: Don’t discuss private or confidential information on the phone or in person where others could overhear.

Information you send over an unsecured public network can be more easily intercepted. Instead, choose well-known Wi-Fi spots typically offered by businesses. If you need to use public Wi-Fi, be sure to use a VPN to access Johnson Controls networks.

revealCallOut.img: Employee working on laptop in airport

popText.text: Be mindful of people around you who may have a view of your screen. Consider using a privacy screen over the display of your device.

Make sure you know where your access swipe card is at all times. Remember to tuck your swipe card into your clothes when
going to and from your workplace.
